ðŸ”¥ telert | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Alerting users when long-running terminal commands or Python code finish executing, enabling them to monitor processes remotely or in CI/CD pipelines.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Sends notifications when terminal commands or Python code completes â€¢ Supports multiple notification channels (Telegram, Microsoft Teams, Slack, Discord, Pushover, HTTP endpoints, desktop notifications, audio alerts)
ðŸ“– Summary: Telert is a utility that sends notifications upon completion of terminal commands or Python code. It supports various notification channels, including messaging apps, mobile devices, and custom HTTP endpoints. It can be used as a CLI tool, Python library, or a notification API, making it suitable for monitoring long-running tasks, remote servers, and CI/CD pipelines.

ðŸŒŸ PastebinSearch | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Searching for terms on Pastebin using multiple search engines to investigate leaked data or specific content.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multi-Search Engine Support (Google, Bing, DuckDuckGo, Yahoo) â€¢ Customizable Browser (Firefox, Google Chrome) â€¢ URL Encoding â€¢ Error Handling â€¢ Timeout Support
ðŸ“– Summary: PastebinSearch is a Bash script that automates searching for terms on Pastebin using popular search engines. It supports customizable browsers, URL encoding, and error handling, making it easier to find specific content or investigate leaked data on Pastebin.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ galoisenne | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Implementing graph-based computational models and exploring connections between different domains like neural networks, automata theory, and programming languages using algebraic graph theory.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Graph computation model â€¢ Iterated matrix multiplication on GPUs â€¢ Backpropagation support via Kotlinâˆ‡ â€¢ Unification of message passing schemes
ðŸ“– Summary: Kaliningraph is a Kotlin library implementing a graph computation model that can be translated to iterated matrix multiplication on GPUs. It supports backpropagation and aims to unify various message passing schemes. The library provides inductive definitions for graphs and circuits, enabling exploration of connections between different domains using algebraic graph theory.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ extra-ktor-plugins | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Extending Ktor server and client functionality with pre-built plugins for common tasks like Kafka integration, task scheduling, rate limiting, and circuit breaking.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Kafka integration for Ktor servers â€¢ Task scheduling for distributed Ktor servers â€¢ Rate limiting for Ktor servers
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides a collection of feature-rich plugins for Ktor, a Kotlin multiplatform framework. These plugins enhance Ktor servers and clients with functionalities such as Kafka integration, task scheduling, rate limiting, and circuit breaking. The plugins aim to simplify development and improve the reliability and scalability of Ktor applications.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ cryptography-kotlin | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing a type-safe, multiplatform cryptography library for Kotlin developers.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multiplatform cryptography API â€¢ Secure random number generation
ðŸ“– Summary: cryptography-kotlin is a Kotlin Multiplatform library that offers a unified API for various cryptographic operations. It supports multiple algorithms and providers, such as OpenSSL, WebCrypto, and JDK, allowing developers to easily integrate secure cryptographic functionalities into their Kotlin applications across different platforms. The library focuses on providing a type-safe and consistent experience while leveraging well-established cryptography solutions.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ kopy | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Generating nested copies (deep copies) of Kotlin data classes and other objects, ensuring that all nested objects are also copied, not just referenced.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Kotlin compiler plugin for generating deep copy functions â€¢ K2 compiler support â€¢ Gradle plugin integration â€¢ Configurable copy function generation (copy, invoke, or both)
ðŸ“– Summary: Kopy is a Kotlin compiler plugin that simplifies the creation of deep copies. It automates the generation of `copy` and `invoke` functions for data classes, ensuring that all nested objects are properly copied. The plugin integrates with Gradle and supports the K2 compiler, offering configuration options for debugging and function generation.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ comprehensive-rust | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Teaching Rust to experienced software engineers, particularly those with a background in C++ or Java.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Comprehensive Rust course material â€¢ Covers basic syntax to advanced topics like generics and error handling â€¢ Includes deep dives on Android, Chromium, bare-metal, and concurrency
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides comprehensive Rust course materials developed by the Android team at Google. It covers a wide range of Rust topics and includes specific modules for Android, Chromium, bare-metal systems, and concurrency. The course is designed for classroom instruction and aims to help experienced engineers quickly learn Rust.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ subcat | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Passive subdomain discovery for security professionals and bug bounty hunters.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Fast Enumeration â€¢ Curated Passive Sources â€¢ Lightweight & Efficient â€¢ STDIN/STDOUT Integration â€¢ IP Scope Filtering
ðŸ“– Summary: SubCat is a subdomain discovery tool designed for penetration testers, bug bounty hunters, and security researchers. It passively aggregates data from various online sources to identify valid subdomains, offering features like fast enumeration, curated passive sources, IP scope filtering, and detailed output. The tool is built to comply with licensing and usage restrictions, ensuring minimal impact on target systems.
